newsitem.title: CANADA: Ethyl won't press Canada suit if MMT bill dropped.
newsitem.headline: Ethyl won't press Canada suit if MMT bill dropped.

text.p: Ethyl Corp said on Wednesday it would not proceed with plans for a US$200 million lawsuit against the Canadian government if Parliament rejects a bill which would effectively ban the gasoline additive MMT.
"We obviously won't move forward if the bill doesn't pass," Chris Hicks, vice president for government relations at Ethyl Canada, told a Senate committee considering the bill.

Ethyl Canada imports MMT, methylcyclopentadienyl manganese tricarbonyl, from its parent Ethyl Corp. No other company in Canada makes or imports MMT, which boosts octane and has been used as a replacement for lead in Canada since 1977.

The Canadian parliament passed a bill in December to ban the import and interprovincial trade of MMT, on the grounds that it hurts cars' emission diagnostic systems and may be unhealthy -- charges Ethyl challenges.
The Senate, which has the power to kill or at least delay the bill, is now considering it.
